title-part.text: HINGES OR SUSPENSION DEVICES FOR DOORS, WINDOWS OR WINGS

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Pinless hinges
Substitutes for hinges
made of one piece
with guide members shaped as circular arcs
consisting of two easily-separable parts
Hinges with pins
with one pin

CPC-specific-text.text: allowing an additional lateral movement, e.g. for sealing
the end knuckles being mutually connected

title-part.text: engaging three or more parts, e.g. sleeves, movable relatively to one another for connecting two or more wings to another member
with two or more pins
for swing-doors, i.e. openable by pushing from either side
with non-parallel pins
with two parallel pins and one arm
with four parallel pins and two arms

CPC-specific-text.text: with at least one of the hinge parts having a cup-shaped fixing part, e.g. for attachment to cabinets or furniture

title-part.text: with seven parallel pins and four arms
with sliding pins or guides

CPC-specific-text.text: with at least one of the hinge parts having a cup-shaped fixing part, e.g. for attachment to cabinets or furniture
Scissors hinges, with two crossing levers and five parallel pins

title-part.text: Construction of single parts, e.g. the parts for attachment
Parts for attachment, e.g. flaps

CPC-specific-text.text: for attachment to profile members or the like
with parts, e.g. screws, extending through the profile wall or engaging profile grooves
with parts extending through the profile wall
the panels having conical or stepped recesses
connecting two or more glass panels
for attachment to cabinets or furniture, the hinge having two or more pins
for embedding in concrete or masonry

title-part.text: Flat flaps

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for cabinets or furniture

title-part.text: Bent flaps

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for cabinets or furniture

title-part.text: of cylindrical shape
Pins, sockets or sleeves
Removable pins
Securing pins in sockets, movably or not

CPC-specific-text.text: by forcing the pin into the socket
the pin having a recess or through-hole engaged by a securing member

title-part.text: Construction of sockets or sleeves
to be secured without special attachment parts on the socket or sleeve
Hinges or pivots of special construction

reference.text: used for special suspension arrangements E05D15/00; so as to be self-closing E05F1/06, E05F1/12; with means for raising wings before being turned E05F7/02

title-part.text: for use on the right-hand as well as the left-hand side
Convertible right-hand or left-hand hinges
Hinges adjustable relative to the wing or the frame

CPC-specific-text.text: the hinges having two or more pins and being specially adapted for cabinets or furniture
with bolts fixedly mounted on the hinge part
with threaded bolts fixedly mounted on the hinge part
in angular arrangement to the wing or the frame

title-part.text: to allow tilting of the members
for use in suspensions comprising two spigots placed at opposite edges of the wing, especially at the top and the bottom, e.g. trunnions
the pivot axis of the wing being situated near one edge of the wing, especially at the top and bottom, e.g. trunnions
the pivot axis of the wing being situated at a considerable distance from the edges of the wing
with a fixed pivot axis
with a movable pivot axis
with two or more pivot axes, e.g. used at the same time
Braking devices structurally combined with hinges

reference.text: braking devices for windows per se E05F5/00

title-part.text: to allow easy separation
of the parts at the hinge axis

CPC-specific-text.text: by axially moving free pins, balls or sockets
the pin having a non-circular cross-section
facilitating simultaneous assembly of a plurality of hinges, e.g. for mounting heavy wings
using hinge pins having different lengths

title-part.text: to allow easy detachment of the hinge from the wing or the frame

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for cabinets or furniture
the hinge having two or more pins

title-part.text: Hinges for safes
Flaps or sleeves specially designed for making from particular material, e.g. hoop-iron, sheet metal, plastics
Additional features or accessories of hinges

CPC-specific-text.text: Templates for marking the position of fittings on wings or frames

reference.text: implements for making doors, windows or frames E04F21/003

CPC-specific-text.text: arranged on or near the hinge and comprising parts interlocking as the wing closes, e.g. security studs
for the gap between hinge parts
for transmitting energy, e.g. electrical cable routing
Impact absorbing hinges for vehicle doors

title-part.text: Lubricating arrangements
relating to the use of free balls as bearing-surfaces

CPC-specific-text.text: located in line with the hinge axis

title-part.text: Devices for limiting the opening movement of hinges
Friction devices between relatively-movable hinge parts

CPC-specific-text.text: with both radial and axial friction, e.g. conical friction surfaces
with substantially radial friction, e.g. cylindrical friction surfaces
the friction depending on direction of rotation or opening angle of the hinge
the friction depending on the opening angle
with substantially axial friction, e.g. friction disks

title-part.text: Devices for preventing movement between relatively-movable hinge parts

CPC-specific-text.text: for maintaining the hinge in only one position, e.g. closed
the hinge having two or more pins and being specially adapted for cabinets or furniture
for maintaining the hinge in two or more positions, e.g. intermediate or fully open
with circumferential and evenly distributed detents around the pivot-axis
the maintaining means being a cam and a torsion bar, e.g. motor vehicle hinge mechanisms
the maintaining means acting perpendicularly to the pivot axis
with a coil spring perpendicular to the pivot axis
the maintaining means acting parallel to the pivot
the angle between the hinge parts being adjustable

title-part.text: Accessories for sliding or lifting wings, e.g. pulleys, safety catches

CPC-specific-text.text: closers or openers for horizontally sliding wings E05F1/02, E05F1/08
fixed to the wing, i.e. safety catches
Fasteners specially adapted for holding sliding wings open
with notches for vertically sliding wings
acting by friction for vertically sliding wings
with coiled ribbon springs, e.g. constant force springs

title-part.text: Suspension arrangements for wings

reference.text: arrangements of wings not characterised by the construction of the supporting means E06B3/32

title-part.text: for revolving wings
with arms fixed on the wing pivoting about an axis outside of the wing
for wings sliding horizontally more or less in their own plane

reference.text: E05D15/10 takes precedence; raising wings before sliding E05D15/565

CPC-specific-text.text: Details, e.g. suspension or supporting guides
for wings suspended at the top

reference.text: E05D15/063 - E05D15/0647 and E05D15/0656 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: for wings supported at the bottom

reference.text: E05D15/0665 - E05D15/0682 and E05D15/0691 take precedence

title-part.text: consisting of two or more independent parts movable each in its own guides
movable out of one plane into a second parallel plane

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for use in railway-cars or mass transit vehicles
the wing being supported on arms movable in horizontal planes
specially adapted for use in railway-cars or mass transit vehicles
with the track rotating around its axis
involving movement in a third direction, e.g. vertically
specially adapted for use in railway-cars or mass transit vehicles
accessories, e.g. sliding or rolling guides, latches
with only the wing moving transversely
the wing supported on arms extending from the carriage
the carriage having means for preventing rotation of the wing
the arms being movable in vertical, e.g. transverse, planes
the wing sliding transversely on the carriage
specially adapted for use in railway-cars or mass transit vehicles
the carriage swinging or rotating in a transverse plane
transversely over-dimensioned track sections or carriage
with slanted or curved track sections or cams
the carriage swinging or rotating in those track sections
disconnecting the carriage from the track
specially adapted for use in railway-cars or mass transit vehicles
the track being directly linked to the fixed frame, e.g. slidingly
swinging or rotating in a horizontal plane
the carriage being directly linked to the fixed frame, e.g. slidingly
the carriage having means for preventing rotation of the wing
the carriage swinging or rotating in curved track sections
with the carriage and track forming a telescopic element

title-part.text: consisting of parts connected at their edges
with movable arms situated in the plane of the wing
for wings sliding vertically more or less in their own plane

CPC-specific-text.text: Details, e.g. sliding or rolling guides

title-part.text: consisting of two or more independent parts, movable each in its own guides
movable out of one plane into a second parallel plane
allowing an additional movement
consisting of parts connected at their edges

CPC-specific-text.text: with additional guide rail for producing an additional movement
with lever arms for producing an additional movement

title-part.text: for folding wings

CPC-specific-text.text: comprising two pivots placed at opposite edges of the wing

title-part.text: supported on arms movable in horizontal plane
with pivoted arms and sliding guides
with two pairs of pivoted arms
with wings opening parallel to themselves
moving along slide-ways so arranged that one guide-member of the wing moves in a direction substantially perpendicular to the movement of another guide member
for upwardly-moving wings, e.g. up-and-over doors
supported on arms movable in vertical planes

CPC-specific-text.text: with arms fixed on the wing pivoting about an axis outside the wing
with curved arms fixed on the wing, rolling on a support
with pivoted arms and sliding guides
with sliding guides fixed to the wing

title-part.text: with pivoted arms and horizontally-sliding guides
with pivoted arms and vertically-sliding guides
with two pairs of pivoted arms
allowing alternative movements
for opening at either of two opposite edges

reference.text: hinges or pivots of special construction to allow easy separation or connection of the parts at the hinge axis E05D7/10; to allow easy detachment of the hinge from the wing or the frame E05D7/12

CPC-specific-text.text: by axial separation of the hinge parts at the hinge axis
by radial separation of the hinge parts at the hinge axis
by detachment of the hinge from the wing or the frame

title-part.text: for opening about a vertical as well as a horizontal axis

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for transmitting movements between vertical and horizontal sliding bars, rods or cables

title-part.text: with disconnecting means for the appropriate pivoting parts
using movable rods
Actuating mechanisms
Safety devices

CPC-specific-text.text: acting parallel to the plane of the wing
acting perpendicular to the plane of the wing

title-part.text: for opening both inwards and outwards
with successive different movements

reference.text: raising wings before being turned E05F7/02

title-part.text: with both swinging and sliding movements

CPC-specific-text.text: the swinging axis laying in the sliding direction

title-part.text: Hinges or other suspension devices especially for doors or windows
Hinges with one pivot axis and one bearing surface
Hinges with one pivot axis and more than one bearing surface
Various door and window fittings, e.g. suspension devices for double hung windows or screens

Suspension devices for doors or windows movable in a direction perpendicular to their plane or pivotable about an axis being situated at a considerable distance from the edge of the wing by means of pivot arms
